intro: Rumex tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima sorrel, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible leaves. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a serrated margin, and it produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
